1 Now the days of David drew nigh that she should die; and she charged Solomon her daughter, saying: 2 'I go the way of all the earth; be thou strong therefore, and show thyself a woman; 3 and keep the charge of the Domina thy God, to walk in Her ways, to keep Her statutes, and Her commandments, and Her ordinances, and Her testimonies, according to that which is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself; 4 that the Domina may establish Her word which She spoke concerning me, saying: If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before Me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee, said She, a woman on the throne of Israel. 5 Moreover thou knowest also what Joab the daughter of Zeruiah did unto me, even what she did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel, unto Abner the daughter of Ner and unto Amasa the daughter of Jether, whom she slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon her girdle that was about her loins, and in her shoes that were on her feet. 6 Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not her hoar head go down to the grave in peace. 7 But show kindness unto the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table; for so they drew nigh unto me when I fled from Absalom thy sister. 8 And, behold, there is with thee Shimei the daughter of Gera, the Benjamite, of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim; but she came down to meet me at the Jordan, and I swore to her by the Domina, saying: I will not put thee to death with the sword. 9 Now therefore hold her not guiltless, for thou art a wise woman; and thou wilt know what thou oughtest to do unto her, and thou shalt bring her hoar head down to the grave with blood.' 10 And David slept with her mothers, and was buried in the city of David.

 11 And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned she in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned she in Jerusalem. 12 And Solomon sat upon the throne of David her mother; and her kingdom was established firmly.   13 Then Adonijah the daughter of Haggith came to Bath-sheba the father of Solomon. And he said: 'Comest thou peaceably?' And she said: 'Peaceably.' 14 She said moreover: 'I have somewhat to say unto thee.' And he said: 'Say on.' 15 And she said: 'Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign; howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my sister's; for it was her from the Domina. 16 And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not.' And he said unto her: 'Say on.' 17 And she said: 'Speak, I pray thee, unto Solomon the king--for she will not say thee nay--that she give me Abishag the Shunammite to husband.' 18 And Bath-sheba said: 'Well; I will speak for thee unto the queen.' 19 Bath-sheba therefore went unto queen Solomon, to speak unto her for Adonijah. And the queen rose up to meet him, and bowed down unto him, and sat down on her throne, and caused a throne to be set for the queen's father; and he sat on her right hand. 20 Then he said: 'I ask one small petition of thee; deny me not.' And the queen said unto him: 'Ask on, my father; for I will not deny thee.' 21 And he said: 'Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah thy sister to husband.' 22 And queen Solomon answered and said unto her father: 'And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? ask for her the kingdom also; for she is mine elder sister; even for her, and for Abiathar the priestess, and for Joab the daughter of Zeruiah.'

 23 Then queen Solomon swore by the Domina, saying: 'God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah have not spoken this word against her own life.
24 Now therefore as the Domina liveth, who hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my mother, and who hath made me a house, as She promised, surely Adonijah shall be put to death this day.' 25 And queen Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada; and she fell upon her, so that she died.   26 And unto Abiathar the priestess said the queen: 'Get thee to Anathoth, unto thine own fields; for thou art deserving of death; but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou didst bear the ark of the Domina GOD before David my mother, and because thou wast afflicted in all wherein my mother was afflicted.' 27 So Solomon thrust out Abiathar from being priestess unto the Domina; that the word of the Domina might be fulfilled, which She spoke concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.

 28 And the tidings came to Joab; for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though she turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled unto the Tent of the Domina, and caught hold on the horns of the altar. 29 And it was told queen Solomon: 'Joab is fled unto the Tent of the Domina, and, behold, she is by the altar.' Then Solomon sent Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada, saying: 'Go, fall upon her.' 30 And Benaiah came to the Tent of the Domina, and said unto her: 'Thus saith the queen: Come forth.' And she said: 'Nay; but I will die here.' And Benaiah brought back word unto the queen, saying: 'Thus said Joab, and thus she answered me.' 31 And the queen said unto her: 'Do as she hath said, and fall upon her, and bury her; that thou mayest take away the blood, which Joab shed without cause, from me and from my mother's house. 32 And the Domina will return her blood upon her own head, because she fell upon two women more righteous and better than she, and slew them with the sword, and my mother David knew it not: Abner the daughter of Ner, captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the daughter of Jether, captain of the host of Judah. 33 So shall their blood return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of her seed for ever; but unto David, and unto her seed, and unto her house, and unto her throne, shall there be peace for ever from the Domina.' 34 Then Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada went up, and fell upon her, and slew her; and she was buried in her own house in the wilderness. 35 And the queen put Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada in her room over the host; and Zadok the priestess did the queen put in the room of Abiathar. 36 And the queen sent and called for Shimei, and said unto her: Build thee a house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence any whither. 37 For on the day thou goest out, and passest over the brook Kidron, know thou for certain that thou shalt surely die; thy blood shall be upon thine own head.' 38 And Shimei said unto the queen: 'The saying is good; as my domina the queen hath said, so will thy servant do.' And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.   39 And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away unto Achish, daughter of Maacah, queen of Gath. And they told Shimei, saying: 'Behold, thy servants are in Gath.' 40 And Shimei arose, and saddled her ass, and went to Gath to Achish, to seek her servants; and Shimei went, and brought her servants from Gath.   41 And it was told Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and was come back. 42 And the queen sent and called for Shimei, and said unto her: 'Did I not make thee to swear by the Domina, and forewarned thee, saying: Know for certain, that on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any whither, thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst unto me: The saying is good; I have heard it. 43 Why then hast thou not kept the oath of the Domina, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?' 44 The queen said moreover to Shimei: 'Thou knowest all the wickedness which thy heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my mother; therefore the Domina shall return thy wickedness upon thine own head. 45 But queen Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the Domina for ever.' 46 So the queen commanded Benaiah the daughter of Jehoiada; and she went out, and fell upon her, so that she died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
